questions.question: What is the main purpose of multi-threading in Java?
questions.answer: To execute multiple different paths of code at the same time.

questions.question: How do you create a new thread in Java?
questions.answer: By extending the `Thread` class or implementing the `Runnable` interface.

questions.question: What is the difference between using `extends Thread` and implementing the `Runnable` interface?
questions.answer: Using `extends Thread` restricts your class to only extend one other class, while implementing the `Runnable` interface allows you to extend any other class you desire, giving more flexibility.

questions.question: How do you make a thread run concurrently in Java?
questions.answer: By calling the `start()` method on the new thread object.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the `join()` method in Java threads?
questions.answer: To wait for a specific thread to complete its execution before continuing with other tasks.
